intro: Oenotrichia novae-guineae, commonly known as the New Guinea grape, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible berries. These berries are often consumed raw or used in local cuisines. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
